intro: Argyroderma testiculare, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery, hairy leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
